reviewText: There are some grand parts but Mikhalkov must have run out of vodka.. At least half is confusingly  banal
Fascinating epic films, about 20th Century Russian history.

Sequels can be a disappointment. These are after the high bar set by the original. Some great actors are in it Nikita Mikhalkov, Oleg Menshikov, Yevgeny Mironov. The movie tries to move on after the 1st and change the ending of the original which was a bit of a stretch in the way they did. It does it's best to portray the struggle and hardships of WWII.

A very good insight in the harsh years under Stalin, an excellent view on how people tried to live and how some of them managed to survive. Don't forget that many millions of russian soldiers and citizens did not survive WWII. The movie shows the violence in its pure and inhuman way, for some people it might be too much and too cruel. But the reality of war is and will be cruel. In some way it is an anti-war statement. Nikita Mikhalkov acts his role brilliantly.
My wife had me buy them and I LOVE it, acting is great and movie and subtitles are perfect! Buy them

Burnt by the Sun 1 is a great film, one of the greatest. Therefore, expectations were high for BBS 2 (part 1 and 2). However, I was disappointed. It is well worth seeing, but not at all the same class as the first movie.
